body:
It seems issue nr 1 should already work https://github.com/sveltejs/language-tools/pull/2001/files but I still get the error using 
 the latest version `v107.4.2`
Fix for nr 1 in the process of being released

From https://github.com/sveltejs/language-tools/pull/2001/files#diff-dd0247a3d88a542b3919d5a081b791c892b7f5bb554efbfe6378ed5a51ff4e6aR385 I see that `entries` should also work with `+layout.server.js` and `+layout.js` but this code tells something different: https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/e445f2e3a43fe4be5cb2fb6c417ba719a82c90bf/packages/kit/src/utils/exports.js#L72
Yeah the language tools side is wrong here

> Fix for nr 1 in the process of being released

Do I miss something? The commit is included in the latest release but I still get the error

> Yeah the language tools side is wrong here

But wouldn't it make sense in `layout` files too?

> Do I miss something? The commit is included in the latest release but I still get the error

That fix only solved half of the problem

> But wouldn't it make sense in layout files too?

We decided against it because it both complicates the implementation in the framework as well as for the user (what are you generating the entries for, which things to take into account etc etc).

> We decided against it because it both complicates the implementation in the framework as well as for the user (what are you generating the entries for, which things to take into account etc etc).

Ah yeah I can see the problem. So if I have a route like `/[country]/[category]/+page.js` (no `/[country]/+page.js`) I would need to resolve the entries by myself and need to export it like this, right?
```js
export const entries = () =>
	['de', 'at'].map(country =>
		['A', 'B', 'C'].map(category => ({
			country,
			category
		}))
	).flat()
```

issue.title: use the newly announced `entries` feature to mark routes automatically as prerenderable

repository.name: monorepo
repository.description: lix (change control system) && inlang (globalization ecosystem for software built on lix)

issue.title: fix: entry generation with mixed segments
issue.body:
fixes #9877 

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [ ] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [ ] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [ ] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [ ] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [ ] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. Changesets that add features should be `minor` and those that fix bugs should be `patch`. Please prefix changeset messages with `feat:`, `fix:`, or `chore:`.

issue.title: docs: document that `entries` also work in `+server.js` files
issue.body:
add forgotten piece from #9877

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [ ] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [ ] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [ ] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [ ] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. Changesets that add features should be `minor` and those that fix bugs should be `patch`. Please prefix changeset messages with `feat:`, `fix:`, or `chore:`.
